items.sentence: Tom has been spending a lot of money on clothes.
Tom has been taken into custody for questioning.
Tom has been teaching French for thirteen years.
It was obvious that Tom didn\'t want to do that.
It wasn\'t difficult to convince Tom to do that.
It\'s always cheaper in the end to buy the best.
It\'s good to see you and Tom are friends again.
I found my credit card that I thought I\'d lost.
I found out that Tom doesn\'t like his roommate.
Tom is going to get killed if he\'s not careful.
If you had a million dollars, what would you do?
Is something going on that I need to know about?
Tom noticed Mary wasn\'t wearing a wedding ring.
I\'m sick of eating at the same place every day.
Tom put on a bullet-proof vest, just to be safe.
Tom put together a neighborhood basketball team.
I\'ll be back in time for my mother\'s birthday.
You like to talk about architecture, don\'t you?
A customs official asked me to open my suitcase.
I can\'t fit that in my suitcase. It\'s too big.
